private_information: The left peg contains disks from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G
Disks are labeled A smallest through G largest
left_peg_agent.goal: Move all disks from the left peg to the right peg preserving order and never place a larger disk on a smaller one

private_information: The middle peg is initially empty
middle_peg_agent.goal: Support legal moves so that ultimately all disks end on the right peg preserving order

private_information: The right peg is initially empty
right_peg_agent.goal: Receive disks following legal moves so that ultimately all disks end on this peg in correct order

orchestrator.goal: Integrate peg reports and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance for a FastDownwards planner

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right
There are 7 disks labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, G where A is the smallest and G is the largest
At most one disk can be moved at a time
A move consists of taking the top disk from one peg and placing it on top of another peg
It is forbidden to place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk
Initial configuration: left peg from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G; middle peg empty; right peg empty
Goal configuration: right peg from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G; left peg empty; middle peg empty

report.system_prompt: You are the software agent responsible for observing and reporting the current local state of the left peg. Do not emit PDDL. Provide a concise description of the stack of disks you control and enumerate all legally possible single-disk moves that you can perform from your peg given the rules and the public information.
report.prompt: Your name is left_peg_agent. Use the public information and your private information to report the local state and legal moves. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your knowledge: {agents->left_peg_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->left_peg_agent->goal}. Provide the state and a list of legal move actions in plain text, for example: move A from left to middle. Do not create PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in automated planning and in producing PDDL domains and problems suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the peg reports from the agents, resolve any naming or representation differences, and produce a single coherent PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem that encodes the full Tower of Hanoi instance with seven disks and three pegs. Always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The produced PDDL should be compatible with FastDownwards conventions.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive three reports describing the local states and legal moves from each peg. The reports are: {report_left}, {report_middle}, {report_right}. Use the environment public information: {environment->public_information} and the global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the information to create a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for the FastDownwards solver that models pegs, disks, legal single-disk moves, and the ordering constraint forbidding larger-on-smaller moves. Keep agent actions distinct only if needed to reflect which peg moves a disk, but the domain may use generic move actions parameterized by source and destination pegs. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
